Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: How to print out an ArrayList<Integer> in a HashSet<ArrayList<Integer>>?: :How do you printout an index of type HashSet>?Here is the code:HashSet<ArrayList<Integer>> possibleRoutes;I tried int indexOfMinDistance = routesDistances.indexOf(Collections.min(routesDistances));System.out.println(possibleRoutes.indexOf(indexOfMinDistance));The programme suggests to cast possibleRoutes to List which produces more errors to the problem because they are not of the same type. So how do you print out an index, eg. an ArrayList<Integer>, of a HashSet<ArrayList<Integer>>?
Please using this api: Iterator.next.

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: How to print out an ArrayList<Integer> in a HashSet<ArrayList<Integer>>?: :How do you printout an index of type HashSet>?Here is the code:HashSet<ArrayList<Integer>> possibleRoutes;I tried int indexOfMinDistance = routesDistances.indexOf(Collections.min(routesDistances));System.out.println(possibleRoutes.indexOf(indexOfMinDistance));The programme suggests to cast possibleRoutes to List which produces more errors to the problem because they are not of the same type. So how do you print out an index, eg. an ArrayList<Integer>, of a HashSet<ArrayList<Integer>>?
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<ArrayList<Integer>> iterator = possibleRoutes.iterator();
while(iterator.hasNext()) {
    ArrayList<Integer> route = iterator.next();
    System.out.println(route);
}
<<<explanation>>>: The next() method of the Iterator interface returns the next element in the iteration. This is a terminal operation.
Question: How to convert a List to an array in Java?
Please using this api: List.toArray.
Answer:<<<api>>>: List.toArray
<<<code>>>: List<Integer> list = Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3, 4, 5);
Integer[] array = list.toArray(new Integer[0]);
<<<explanation>>>: The toArray() method of the List interface returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence (from first to last element). This is a terminal operation.
The toArray(T[] a) method returns an array containing all of the elements in this list. If the supplied array is large enough, it is returned therein. Otherwise, a new array is allocated with the runtime type of the specified array and the size of this list. If the list fits in the supplied array, the remaining array elements are set to null.

